data.name: Symmetric Difference
data.description:
Create a function that takes two or more arrays and returns an array of the symmetric difference (△ or ⊕) of the provided arrays.

Given two arrays (for example A = [1, 2, 3] and B = [2, 3, 4]), the mathematical term "symmetric difference" of two arrays is the array of elements which are in either of the two arrays, but not in both (A △ B = C = [1, 4]). 

For every additional symmetric difference you take (say on a array D = [2, 3]), you should get the array with elements which are in either of the two the arrays but not both (C △ D = [1, 4] △ [2, 3] = [1, 2, 3, 4]).

symDiff([1, 2, 5], [2, 3, 5], [3, 4, 5]) should return [1, 4, 5].
